intro: Phlomoides subspicata, commonly known as the slender phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically clustered in whorls along the stem, producing a delicate, lavender-colored display. It is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
